net.metro.analyze

Class WayPointEdit

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • javax.swing.JDialog
              • net.metro.analyze.WayPointEdit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants, MarkerListener, PointListener

    public class WayPointEdit
extends javax.swing.JDialog
implements PointListener, MarkerListener
    Dialog that assists in editing WayPoint information including the type of waypoint (WayPoint or Stop), the location, and if a stop, the stop's name and id.
    Author:
    Sean Harger
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • WayPointEdit

        public WayPointEdit(WayPoint wp,
            LineEdit lnEdtFrm,
            int frmTyp)
        Constructs a WayPointEdit.
        Parameters:
        wp - WayPoint to edit
        lnEdtFrm - LineEditFrame from which this dialog was invoked
        frmTyp - integer constant representing the frame type:
        WayPointEdit.TYPE_WAYPOINT: for editing waypoints WayPointEdit.TYPE_STOP: for editing stops (includes two extra text fields)

    • Method Detail

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Disposes this WayPointEdit frame normally, but removes all references to itself as a MarkerListener and PointListener, and turns off marker movement and turns on marker selection.
        Overrides:
        dispose in class java.awt.Window

      • getSelectedWayPointType

        private int getSelectedWayPointType()
        Returns the type of waypoint indicated by the selected radio button.
        Returns:
        WayPointEdit.TYPE_STOP if "Stop" is selected, or WayPointEdit.TYPE_WAYPOINT if "WayPoint" is selected.

      • registerWayPointTypeChange

        private void registerWayPointTypeChange()
        Adjusts the visible items in the WayPointEdit dialog according to the selected waypoint type from the radio buttons. If "Stop" is selected, then a special frame is shown that allows the user to edit the stop name and id.

      • processChanges

        private void processChanges()
        Attempts to commit the changes made by the user for the WayPoint this dialog was created to edit. If the user attempts to place a non-numerical character in the latitude and longitude fields, then an error message is shown.

      • confirmChanges

        private void confirmChanges()
        Processes the changes made by the user and closes the dialog.

      • cancelChanges

        private void cancelChanges()
        Cancels the changes made by the user. If the WayPoint being edited was created as a new waypoint, then it is removed from its RoutePath upon cancellation.

      • setInitialState

        private void setInitialState()

      • setUpGui

        private void setUpGui()
        Initializes the GUI elements for this WayPointEdit.

      • pointSelected

        public void pointSelected(PointListener.PointEvent e)
        If a point is selected by the user in the SystemMap, then the coordinates of that point are set as the new coordinates for this WayPoint.
        Specified by:
        pointSelected in interface PointListener
        Parameters:
        e - PointEvent object

      • markerSelected

        public void markerSelected(MarkerListener.MarkerEvent e)
        No implementation.
        Specified by:
        markerSelected in interface MarkerListener
        Parameters:
        e - MarkerEvent object indicating the selected marker.

      • markerMoved

        public void markerMoved(MarkerListener.MarkerEvent e)
        If a marker is moved by the user, then the coordinates of the final point are set as the new coordinates for this WayPoint.
        Specified by:
        markerMoved in interface MarkerListener
        Parameters:
        e - MarkerEvent object indicating the marker moved and the location moved to.

      • markerMoving

        public void markerMoving(MarkerListener.MarkerEvent e)
        No implementation.
        Specified by:
        markerMoving in interface MarkerListener
        Parameters:
        e - MarkerEvent object indicating the marker moving and the current position of the user's mouse.

        No implementation.
